datafield.subfield: Center for Global and Intercultural Study.
Center for Global and Intercultural Study (University of Michigan) records,
Organized into five series: 1. Background. 2. Administrative Files. 3. Programs. 4. Correspondence. 5. Photographs.
Background, Administrative Files, Programs, Correspondence, and Photographs

A unit of the University of Michigan College of Literature, Science and the Arts. Office that administered foreign travel and study programs the University of Michigan; records document administration of program, content of curriculum and student experience.

In the 1960s, the University of Michigan College of Literature, Science and the Arts established and administered student overseas travel and study programs. In the early 1970s, the college centralized administration of the programs in the Center for Western European Studies (CWES). By that time the programs included a joint program with Sarah Lawrence University in London, and the University of Michigan-University of Wisconsin Academic Year Program in Italy. In 1983, CWES was reorganized and given

control over all international study programs. CWES established an executive committee as the agent to oversee operations, and four other committees to handle various tasks. The committees included: Foreign Study, International Exchange and Fellowships, On-campus Programs, and Colloquia and Conferences. By 1989, the Office of International Programs (OIP) had replaced the Center for Western European Studies as the overseeing agency.

The OIP was later replaced by the Center for Global and Intercultural Study (CGIS), which was founded in July 2009 to provide a wide variety of global engagement and learning opportunities to the University of Michigan Community.

The record group is divided in to five series: Background, Administrative Files, Programs, Correspondence, Executive Committee Meeting Minutes, and Photographs. The Background series provides a brief introduction to CWES activities. Administrative Files includes minutes of executive committee and other office committees, reports, and various administrative documents.

Programs is an alphabetical arrangement of files on the programs administered by CWES. The programs in Florence, Paris, Aix-en-Provence, London, and Freiburg comprise the bulk of this series. Correspondence concerns the internal working of the programs.

19 black and white interior photographs of the Villa Boscobello, used as the residence in Florence for the University of Michigan-University of Wisconsin Academic Year Program in Italy; also black and white photographs of a student gathering in Aix-en-Provence.
Finding aid available via World Wide Web at URL: http://quod.lib.umich.edu/cgi/f/findaid/findaid-idx?c=bhlead&idno=umich-bhl-93819
